englishNarrator: Abdullah bin Abu Mulaika said:
hadithEnglish: The daughter of 'Uthman bin 'Affan رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ died in Mecca. We came to attend her (funeral). Ibn 'Umar and Ibn 'Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ were also present there, and I was sitting between them. He added: I (first sat) by the side of one of them, then the other one came and he sat by my side. 'Abdullah bin 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ said to 'Amr bin 'Uthman who was sitting opposite to him: Will you not prevent the people from lamenting, for the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) had said: The dead is punished because of the lamenting of his family for him ? Ibn 'Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ then said that Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ used to say someting of that nature, and then narrated saying: I proceeded from Mecca along with 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ till we reached al-Baida' and there was a party of riders under the shade of a tree. He said (to me): Go and find out who this party is. I cast a glance and there was Suhaib رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ (in that party). So I informed him ('Umar) about it. He said: Call him to me. So I went back to Suhaib and said: Go and meet the Commander of the believers. When 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ was wounded, Suhaib came walling: Alas, for the brother! alas for the companion! 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ said: O Suhaib, do you wail for me, whereas the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: The dead would be punished on account of the lamentation of the (members of his family) ? Ibn 'Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ said: When 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ died I made a mention of it to 'A'isha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا . She said: May Allah have mercy upon 'Umar! I swear by Allah that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) never said that Allah would punish the believer because of the weeping (of any one of the members of his family), but he said that Allah would increase the punishment of the unbeliever because of the weeping of his family over him. 'A'isha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا said: The Qur'an is enough for you (when it states): No bearer of burden will bear another's burden (vi. 164). Thereupon Ibn 'Abbas رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ said: Allah is He Who has caused laughter and weeping. Ibn Abu Mulaika said: By Allah, Ibn 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ said nothing.

englishNarrator: Amr reported on the authority of Ibn Abu Mulaika:
hadithEnglish: We were with the bier of Umm Aban, daughter of 'Uthman رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ , and the rest of the hadith is the same, but he did not narrate it as a marfu' hadith on the authority of 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ from the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as it was narrated by Ayyub and Ibn Juraij, and the hadith narrated by them (Ayyub and Ibn Juraij) is more complete than that of 'Amr.

englishNarrator: Abdullah bin 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: The dead is punished because of the lamentation of the living.

englishNarrator: Hisham bin 'Urwa narrated on the authority of his father:
hadithEnglish: The saying of Ibn 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ , viz. The dead would be punished because of the lamentation of his family over him was mentioned to 'A'isha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا . Upon this she said: May Allah have mercy upon Abu 'AbdUl-Rahman (the kunya of Ibn 'Umar) that he heard something but could not retain it (well). (The fact is) that the bier of a Jew passed before the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) and (the members of his family) were waiting over him. Upon this he said: You are wailing and he is being punished.

englishNarrator: Hisham narrated on the authority of his father:
hadithEnglish: It was mentioned to 'A'isha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا that Ibn 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ had narrated as marfu' hadith from the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) that the dead would be punished in the grave because of the lamentation of his family for him. Upon this she said: He (Ibn 'Umar) missed (the point). The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) had (in fact) said: He (the dead) is punished for his faults or for his sins, and the members of his family are wailing for him now. (This misunderstanding of Ibn 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ is similar to his saying: ) The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) stood by the well in which were lying the dead bodies of those polytheists who had been killed on the Day of Badr, and he said to them what he had to say, i. e.: They hear what I say. But he (Ibn 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ) misunderstood. The Prophet ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) had only said: They (the dead) understand that what I used to say to them was truth. She then recited: Certainly, thou canst not make the dead hear the call (xxvii. 80), nor can you make those hear who are in the graves, nor can you inform them when they have taken their seats in Hell.
This hadith has been narrated by Ibn 'Urwa with the same chain of transmitters. The hadith narrated by Abu Usama is more complete.

englishNarrator: Amra daughter of 'Abdul Rahman narrated:
hadithEnglish: She heard (from) 'A'isha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا and made a mention to her about 'Abdullah bin 'Umar رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ as saying: The dead is punished because of the lamentation of the living. Upon this 'A'isha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا said: May Allah have mercy upon the father of 'Abdul-Rahman (Ibn 'Umar). He did not tell a lie, but he forgot or made a mistake. The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) happened to pass by a (dead) Jewess who was being lamented. Upon this he said: They weep over her and she is being punished in the grave.

englishNarrator: Ali bin Rabi'a reported:
hadithEnglish: The first one who was lamented upon in Kufa was Qaraza bin Ka'b. Mughira bin Shu'ba رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ said: I heard the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) saying: He who is lamented upon would be punished because of the lamentation for him on the Day of judgment.
A hadith like this has been narrated by Mughira bin Shu'ba رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ from the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌).
This hadith has been narrated from the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) through another chain of transmitters.

englishNarrator: Abu Malik al-Ash'ari رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: Among my people there are four characteristics belonging to pre-Islamic period which they do not abandon: boasting of high rank, reviling other peoples' genealogies, seeking rain by stars, and walling. And he (further) said: If the wailing woman does not repent before she dies, she will be made to stand on the Day of Resurrection wearing a garment of pitch and a chemise of mange.

englishNarrator: A'isha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: When the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) was told that Ibn Haritha, Ja'far bin Abu Talib and Abdullah bin Rawaha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ were killed, he sat down, showing signs of grief. She (further) said: I was looking (at him) through the crevice of the door. A man came to him and mentioned that Ja'far's women were lamenting. He (the Holy Prophet) commanded him to go and forbid them (to do so). So he went away but came back and told (him) that they did not obey (him). He commanded him a second time to go and forbid them (to do so). He again went but came back to him and said: I swear by God, Messenger of Allah, that they have overpowered us. She ('A'isha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا ) said that she thought the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) had told (her) to throw dust in their mouths. Thereupon 'A'isha رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا said: May Allah humble you! You did not do what Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) ordered you, nor did you stop annoying Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ).

englishNarrator: This hadith has been narrated by Yahya bin Sa'id with the same chain of transmitters like one narrated by 'Abdul-'Aziz (with the change of these words):
hadithEnglish: You did not spare the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) the botheration.

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) took a promise from us along with the oath of Allegiance that we would not lament. But only five among us fulfilled the promise (and they are) Umm Sulaim, and Umm al-'Ala', and the daughter of Abu Sabra the wife of Mu'adh رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ , or daughter of Abu Sabra and wife of Mu'adh رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہ .

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) took pledge from us (including this promise) that we would not lament. Only five amongst us fulfilled the promise, and one of them (who fulfilled the promise) was Umm Sulaim رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا .

englishNarrator: Hafsa narrated on the authority of Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا that she said:
hadithEnglish: When this verse was revealed: When believing women came to thee giving thee a pledge that they will not associate aught with Allah, and will not disobey thee in good (lx. 12), she (Umm Atiyya) said: In (this pledge) was also included wailing. I said: Messenger of Allah, except members of such a tribe who helped me (in lamentation) during pre-Islamic days, there is left no alternative for me, but that I should also help them. Upon this the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: (Yes) but only in case of the members of such a tribe.

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: We were forbidden to follow the bier, but it was not made absolute on us.

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: We were refrained from following the bier, but it was not made absolute on us.

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: The Apostle of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) came to us when we were bathing his daughter, and he told us: Wash her with water and (with the leaves of) the lote tree, three or five times, or more than that if you think fit, and put camphor or something like camphor in the last washing; then inform me when you have finished. So when we had finished, we informed him, and he gave to us his (own) under-garment saying: Put it next her body.

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: We braided her hair in three plaits.

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: One of the daughters of the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) died. And in the hadith transmitted by Ibn 'Ulayya (the words are): The Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) came to us and we were washing his daughter. And in the hadith transmitted by Malik (the words are): There came in (our apartment) the Messenger of Allah (way peace be upon him) when his daughter died. The rest of the hadith is the same as narrated by Yazid bin Zurai' from Ayyub from Muhammad from Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا.

englishNarrator: A hadith like this has been transmitted by Hafsa on the authority of Umm 'Atiyya with the exception (of these words that the Prophet asked them to wash her dead body):
hadithEnglish: Three times, five times, seven times, or more than that, if you deem fit: Hafsa (further) said on the authority of Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا : We braided (the hair) of her head in three plaits.

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: We washed her an odd number of times, i.e. three, five or seven times; and Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا (further) said: We braided her hair in three plaits.

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: When Zainab رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا the daughter of the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) died, he said to us: Wash her odd number of times, i. e. three or five times, and put camphor or something-like camphor at the fifth time, and after you have washed her inform me. So we informed him and he gave us his under-garment, saying: Put it next her body.

englishNarrator: Umm 'Atiyya رضی اللہ تعالیٰ عنہا reported:
hadithEnglish: There came to us the Messenger of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as we were washing one of his daughters. So he said: Wash her (dead body) an odd number of times, five times or more than that, the rest of the hadith is the same. She (further) said: We braided her hair in three plaits: (two) on the sides of her head and one on her forehead.
